result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Erik McFarland

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

2:50 PM Defendant Jason L Beaber in court.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Jason L Beaber. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:01 PM Defendant Jason L Beaber in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Jason L Beaber. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
(Jail gave him next court date)

1:45 PM Defendant Jason L Beaber not in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court for Jason L Beaber. 

Defendant fails to appear. 

State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.
ADA Mutchler would request a warrant with a $1,000 cash alternative.
Atty McFarland has nothing else to add.

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant with $500 cash alternative

1:23 PM Debtor Jason L Beaber  appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of WI. Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of WI. Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule is present in court.
ADA Cassidy  states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine and Drug Paraphernalia. 
Atty Soule  does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
